intro: Erysimum resediflorun, commonly known as the sweet rocket, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its bright yellow, showy flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are hairy and serrated. Native to southern Europe, it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant color and ease of cultivation.
